page.title: 14CHANGES IN TRESWELL
page.content: The old Chapel was demolished two or three years ago. The new Chapel is still in use. The village used to be served by two butchers from Rampton and a baker. A horse drawn fish and chip van also called at the village. A grocer came from Retford and a pots and pans man from near by Dunham. The farmers sold milk and butter to the village and most people kept a pig to fatten and kill. There was a station at South Leverton and as local carrier would collect fruit and vegetables to send to Sheffield Market. Electricity supply was installed in 1935 and mains water came in 1936.
